questions.question: Since nobody went grocery shopping, we decided to go out for dinner.

choices.answer: simple sentence
compound sentence
complex sentence
complex-compound sentence

questions.question: Jenn likes to cook, but she doesn't enjoy baking.

choices.answer: simple sentence
compound sentence
complex sentence
complex-compound sentence

questions.question: I was late for work, but it wasn't a problem because my boss is understanding.

choices.answer: simple sentence
compound sentence
complex sentence
compound-complex sentence

questions.question: Jennifer and Liz decided the garage needed to be cleaned and organized this weekend.

choices.answer: simple sentence
compound sentence
complex sentence
complex-compound sentence

questions.question: Which of the following sentences is punctuated correctly?

choices.answer: She studied for her math test but she forgot about science.
After we ate dinner we went to the movies.
I ordered nachos, and chicken wings.
We are really looking forward to vacation this year.

questions.question: Which of the following sentences is punctuated correctly?

choices.answer: You can stay home or you can go to the movies.
Beth hates peanuts and she is allergic.
Before David left, he made sure all the doors were locked.
She was late for school, because her alarm didn't work.

questions.question: Which of the following sentences is punctuated correctly?

choices.answer: Hartford, and Bridgeport are large cities.
I will either take guitar, or swimming lessons this summer.
Since I studied the test wasn't that difficult.
My mom made the lemon cake that Grandma used to make for us.

questions.question: Which of the following sentences is punctuated correctly?

choices.answer: Sue, who is always late, missed first period again.
I lost points for the assignment, that I forgot at home.
Even though it is March it could still snow.
Dana loves dogs yet she has never had one of her own.

questions.question: A compound sentence is formed when two independent clauses are joined by  . . .

choices.answer: a comma and subordinating conjunction
a comma and FANBOYS
a comma and relative pronoun
a colon and preposition

questions.question: A complex sentence contains

choices.answer: 1 independent clause
2 independent clauses
only phrases
1 independent clause and 1 or more dependent clauses

questions.question: An independent clause has

choices.answer: a subject and verb and is an incomplete thought
only a subject and is a complete thought
a subject and a verb and is a complete thought
only a verb and is an incomplete thought

questions.question: A dependent clause

choices.answer: has only a subject and is an incomplete thought
has a subject and verb and is an incomplete thought
has a subject and verb and is a complete thought
always requires a comma to join an independent clause

questions.question: A compound sentence has

choices.answer: 1 independent clause
2 independent clauses
1 independent clause and 1 or more dependent clauses
2 or more independent clauses & 1 or more dependent clauses

questions.question: A simple sentence has

choices.answer: 1 independent clause
2 independent clauses
1 independent clause and 1 or more dependent clauses
2 or more independent clauses & 1 or more dependent clauses

questions.question: A compound-complex sentence has

choices.answer: 1 independent clause
2 independent clauses
1 independent clause and 1 or more dependent clauses
2 or more independent clauses & 1 or more dependent clauses

questions.question: A comma in a complex sentence is REQUIRED when

choices.answer: the dependent clause begins the sentence
the dependent clause ends the sentence
the dependent clause starts with "that"
the dependent clause has more than five words in it

questions.question: A phrase

choices.answer: has a subject and its verb
is a complete thought
has either a subject or a verb
is the first part of a sentence

questions.question: What do a phrase a dependent clause have in common?

choices.answer: They have subjects and verbs.
They always begin a sentence.
They only have subjects.
They are incomplete thoughts.

questions.question: What are the FANBOYS?

choices.answer: four, another, not, buy, yes, same
first, after, neither, by, yet, same
for, and, nor, but, or, yet, so
boys that love Billie Eilish

questions.question: A noun is always a subject.

choices.answer: True
False
